item.name: Annunciator Panel Switch
item.value: PLACE AND HOLD IN TST POSITION

item.value: for security of attachment and general condition

item.name: Main Wheel Tire

item.name: Fuel Tank Sump Quick Drain Valves
Engine Oil Dipstick/Filler Cap
item.value: Do not operate with less than four quarts.
Fill to nine quarts for extended flight.

item.name: Air Filter
item.value: CHECK for restrictions by dust or other foreign matter

item.name: Nose Wheel Strut and Tire
item.value: CHECK for proper inflation and general condition

item.name: Fuel Tank Sump Quick Drain Valves
Main Wheel Tire
item.value: CHECK for proper inflation and general condition

item.name: Pitot Tube Cover
item.value: REMOVE and check opening for stoppage

item.value: With Master Switch on: a sound of the

item.name: Landing/Taxi Light(s)
item.value: CHECK for condition and cleanliness of cover

item.name: Aileron
item.value: CHECK freedom of movement and security

item.name: The Avionics Master Switch Switch must be OFF during Engine
start to prevent possible damage to avionics
When air temperatures are below 20F (-6C), the use of an
external preheater and an external power source are recommend.
If engine is warm, omit priming procedure above.
If engine floods, place mixture in idle cut off, open throttle
1/2 to full, and crank the engine. When engine fires, advance
mixture to full rich and retard throttle promptly.
If engine is warm, omit priming procedure above.
If engine floods, place mixture in idle cut off, open throttle
1/2 to full, and crank the engine. When engine fires, advance
mixture to full rich and retard throttle promptly.
(RPM drop should not exceed 150 RPM on either
magneto or 50 RPM differential between magnetos)
Propeller
item.value: from high to low RPM; return to high RPM (full in)

item.name: Mixture
item.value: (may be leaned to max power fuel flow placard value)

item.name: Mixture
item.value: to obtain max power fuel flow placard value

item.name: Airspeed
item.value: 80 KIAS at sea level to 72 KIAS at 10.000 ft

item.name: Mixture
item.value: according to max Power Fuel Flow placard value

item.name: Wing Flaps
item.value: after reaching a safe altitude and 70 KIAS

item.name: Fuel Selector Valve
item.value: PUSH DOWN and ROTATE TO OFF

item.name: Fuel Selector Valve
item.value: PUSH DOWN and ROTATE TO OFF

item.name: Selected Field
item.value: FLY OVER, noting terrain and obstructions

item.name: Radio
item.value: giving location and intentions and SQUAWK 7700

item.name: If no power is available, approach at 70 KIAS
with flaps up or at 65 KIAS with 10 flaps.
Approach
item.value: High Winds, Heavy Seas -- INTO THE WIND
Light Winds, Heavy Swells -- PARALLEL TO SWELLS

item.name: Touchdown
item.value: LEVEL ATTITUDE AT ESTABLISHED RATE OF DESCENT

item.name: Face
item.value: CUSHION at touchdown with folded coat

item.name: Airplane
item.value: If necessary, open window and flood cabin
to equalize pressure so doors can be opened.
